1.text: And Jehovah will speak to Moses, saying,

2.text: Command the sons of Israel, and they shall take to thee pure olive oil beaten for the light, to cause the lamp to ascend always.

3.text: From without the vail of the testimony, in the tent of appointment, shall Aaron arrange it from evening to morning, before Jehovah always: a law forever to your generations.

4.text: Upon the pure chandelier shall he arrange the lamps before Jehovah always.

5.text: And take the fine flour and bake it, twelve cakes; two tenths shall be the one cake.

6.text: And put them two rows, six the row, upon the pure table before Jehovah.

7.text: And give upon the row pure frankincense, and it was to the bread for a remembrance; a sacrifice to Jehovah.

8.text: In the day of the Sabbath, in the day of the Sabbath he shall arrange it before Jehovah always, from the sons of Israel, a covenant forever.

9.text: And it was to Aaron and to his sons, and they shall eat it in the holy place: for it is holy of holies to him from the sacrifices of Jehovah a law forever.

10.text: And the son of a woman, an Israelitess, will go forth (he the son of a man an Egyptian) into the midst of the sons of Israel: and they will strive in the camp, the son of the Israelitess, and the man the Israelite.

11.text: And the son of the woman the Israelitess, will curse the name, and will vilify, and they will bring him to Moses: and his motherâ€™s name Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, to the tribe of Dan.

12.text: And they placed him in watch, to declare distinctly to them by the mouth of Jehovah.

13.text: And Jehovah will speak to Moses, saying,

14.text: Bring him vilifying, without the camp; and all they hearing, placed their hands upon his head, and all the assembly stoned him.

15.text: And to the sons of Israel thou shalt speak, saying, When a man, a man shall curse his God and he bore his sin.

16.text: And he vilifying the name of Jehovah, dying, shall die; stoning, all the assembly shall stone him: as the stranger so the native, in his vilifying the name, he shall die.

17.text: And when a man shall smite any soul of man, dying, he shall die.

18.text: And he smiting the soul of cattle, shall recompense soul for soul.

19.text: And when a man shall give a blemish in his neighbor, as he did so it shall be done to him:

20.text: Fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth: as he shall give a blemish in a man so it shall be given in him.

21.text: And be smiting cattle shall recompense it; and he smiting man, shall die.

22.text: One judgment to you; as the stranger so the native shall it be: for I Jehovah your God.

23.text: And Moses will speak to the sons of Israel, and they will bring forth him cursing, without the camp, and they will stone him with stone: and the sons of Israel did as Jehovah commanded Moses.
